lead_paragraph: A parliamentary report accused the central bank of threatening to withhold aid to Irish banks if the government forced senior bond investors to share in the losses.

byline.contributor: Douglas Dalby reported from Dublin, and Jack Ewing from London.
byline.original: By DOUGLAS DALBY and JACK EWING

snippet: A parliamentary report accused the central bank of threatening to withhold aid to Irish banks if the government forced senior bond investors to share in the losses.

headline.main: Report Faults E.C.B. in Irish Banking Collapse
headline.print_headline: Report Faults E.C.B.’s Response to Ireland’s Banking Collapse

abstract: Irish parliamentary committee report finds European Central Bank put undue burden on country's citiezens when it refused to force bond investors to share losses from troubled banks in 2010.
